ISSUE.TITLE: AUTH_HEADER_TYPES configuration
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: I noticed this in the authentication_backend docs : > Configure `django-rest-framework-simplejwt` to use the > `Authorization: JWT <access_token>` header: > > SIMPLE_JWT = { > 'AUTH_HEADER_TYPES': ('JWT',), > } This make it seems like a needed configuration step, but in reality JWT authentication works correctly even without adding this settings, it just use the default `Bearer ` authorization header as per the `django-rest-framework-simplejwt` documentation. This settings is completely independent from djoser and has no impact on its functionality so maybe this instruction should just be removed ?
